poem:
In the Green Spaces  

half still spray  
their silent poison  
on grass where children play—  
  
glyphosate ghosts in the open field,  
whispering warnings—  
yet, like dawn,  
some begin to wake,  
to seed the earth  
with gentler hands,  
leaving the small birds  
to sing their days  
and weeds to weave  
their quiet stories.
